attributes.action: All illegal immigrants to be deported within 48 hours & a 10yr ban from a visa!
attributes.background: All illegal immigrants to be deported within 48 hours & a 10yr ban from a visa!
attributes.additional_details:
Illegal immigrants use £3.7billion worth of taxpayer-funded health and education services every year, 
Each one of them is taking advantage of Britain’s free NHS and schools and is costing the Treasury £4,250 per year on average.
This puts a huge strain on the NHS, Housing and Schools throughout the UK.
Make the only immigration legal to the uk to be pre-approved.
And any illegal immigrant to be deported within 48 hours.
With no new visa applications to be made inside the uk.
 without all the Red tape, we can instantly get rid of the people who should not be here! and also discourage all illegal immigration.
anyone one wishing to come to the uk should apply and be pre-approved for a visa or political asylum before they come.

attributes.action: Legislate 4 weeks paid Parental Leave for the death of a Child.
attributes.background:
Did you know that if your Child dies your employer doesn't have to give you time off from work? You can have "up to 12 months leave for the birth of a child,but just 3 days to grieve your child"
My son Jack was just 23 months old when he tragically died and I discovered this anomaly in law.
attributes.additional_details: In August 2010, my son Jack died just 2 weeks away from his 2nd birthday. I have been tirelessly trying to make a change in his memory.Grief effects us all differently, there is no wrong or right way to grieve but it should be our way in how we choose to grieve.While many good employers offer compassionate leave, there is no statutory right to leave and this needs to change.In 2014 I worked with ACAS to create guidance but still believe bereavement leave needs to be legislated.Will you Sign?

attributes.action: Petition the MOD to collect the statistics for Suicide rates amongst UK Veterens
attributes.background: Reports have indicated that 22 US Armed Forces Veterans commit suicide every day and this has been linked to undiagnosed PTSD from the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan. Currently the MOD do not collect these statistics for UK veterans. Our Vets could be suffering in silence, this needs to change.
attributes.additional_details:
Evidence here. 

https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/324458/PUBLIC_1403616620.pdf

attributes.action: Stop Tony Blair  using taxpayers funding his legal costs for Iraq war defence!
attributes.background: Tony Blair has more than enough finance to fund his own defence. Whereas the families have had to raise their own funds!

attributes.action: Save Banbury Horton General Hospital From Extensive and Dangerous Cuts
attributes.background:
Oxford University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust (OUHFT) is consulting on the way services are provided at the Horton General Hospital in Banbury
Their plans could take away A&E, consultant-led maternity, Special Care Baby Unit (SCBU), 24 hour / 7 day a week children's ward and intensive care.
attributes.additional_details: The John Radcliffe Hospital is yet again expected to be the main bolster for all emergency services. That's fine if you live near by, however what happens when you live 40 minutes to an hour away from the hospital and your in need of assistance, due to either injury, sudden illness or because your in labour. The answer, make your way to the John Radcliffe. This is unacceptable. Please support our campaign. For further information visit the following website. http://www.keepthehortongeneral.org

attributes.action: Get an elctronic sign on York A64 to warn drivers of queues & stationary traffic
attributes.background: I have set up a group on facebook supporting getting an illuminated sign put up to warn motorists of stationary and queing traffic with over 2k members in 24 hrs. A sign well in advance of where the queuing traffic usually is will allow motorists to prepare & take an alternative routes.

attributes.action: NHS pensions for Dental Nurses who work in practices with an NHS contract
attributes.background:
Dental nurses across the UK are working in practices which have NHS contracts but are not entitled to an NHS pension.
Dental nurses are assisting along side Dentists & Therapists who are entitled to their NHS pension so why not the nurses?

attributes.action: An independent England, free of Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland.
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum it is clear that the Indivudual UK countries have different outlooks and different priorities. Let's separate the countries of the United Kingdom into independent countries, free to make their own laws and to control their own borders as they wish.

attributes.action: The UK Government must cut diplomatic ties with Israel until it obeys the law.
attributes.background:
We call on the UK Government to cut diplomatic ties with Israel until such time as it complies with International law.

Israel must end its settlement activity and unlawful occupation of Palestinian land. It is illegal under International law.
attributes.additional_details: Israel must cease its expansion and occupation of all foreign territories. International laws are there for a reason, and the governments that allow Israel to continue its brutal occupation and subjugation of Palestinians are complicit in this brutality. Israel must not be allowed to continue to break International law with impunity. We ask our government to explain why it allows the occupation to continue while maintaining its friendship with a state which acts in this way.

attributes.action: Ask the PM to explain the deception on the true legal status of the EU vote.
attributes.background: The Referendum was an advisory Consultation, not a binding vote. Noone neither Government nor MP's nor Civil Service, raised this fundamental point publicly before the vote. And have not confirmed it since. Why not? Was or is there a Conspiracy of Silence ordered by No. 10?
attributes.additional_details:
1.The EU Referendum Act 2015.
2. House of Commons Briefing Paper CBP-7212, June 2015, Section 5:
“Types of referendum:
This Bill ...does not contain any requirement for the UK Government to implement the results of the referendum, nor set a time limit by which a vote to leave the EU should be implemented. Instead, this is a type of referendum known as pre-legislative or consultative, which enables the electorate to voice an opinion which then influences the Government in its policy decisions."

attributes.action: Allow serving members in armed forces & veterans free travel on public transport
attributes.background: in the uk disabled people unemployed and the old can jump on buses for free and in some areas can use rail networks on a discount, at current the armed forces have to pay for a rail card, yet inthe US , canada and some parts of the EU there veterans and serving soldiers can travel for free.
attributes.additional_details:
the UK has loads of veterans aged 22- 75 with the most being in the    22 - 30  aged group for the first time since WW2 due to commitments in afghan and iraq in the last decade,
TFL has awarded a 3 year Oyster card for veterans who have been injured in service, this should not be a perk but a recconition to the service given and extended to all train and bus companies in the UK
 at any time with either there military id or veterans badge.

attributes.action: Do Not Grant An Amnesty To allow illegal immigrants to remain after Brexit
attributes.background:
There is a petition active calling for an amnesty which will allow illegal immigrants to remain in the UK after Brexit. 
This shouldn't happen. They are here illegally and should be treated as such

attributes.action: Reject the plan to devolve powers to a Metro Mayor for The West of England.
attributes.background: The Chancellor of The Exchequer announced on March 16th a scheme to devolve powers to a Metro Mayor in Bristol, Bath and surrounding areas. Given that B&NES rejected an elected Mayoral model one week earlier, this new announcement seems to be at variance with the electorate's preferences.

attributes.action: Merge class 2 and and pcv licences into one
attributes.background:
Bus drivers carry the most precious cargo in the world, but cant drive a 32 tonne lorry full of groceries 
Give category D license holders their class 2 lgv license

attributes.action: We want the government to explain why there was no threshold in the Referendum
attributes.background: TU strike ballots and countries voting on constitutional matters set a 2/3 majority for change. It's inconceivable this didn't have one.Was it because it was advisory, a purely consultative exercise not binding on this or any other government or was it just a careless,omission?
attributes.additional_details: The narrow Leave majority of 52% represents only 37% of the electorate. Important groups affected by it were not allowed to vote e.g. 16-18 year olds. This is too small to be a government mandate to leave the EU with the dire economic consequences already seen. The MPs Code of Conduct obliges them to do what is best for the NATION i.e. Scotland, NI, Wales and England.If a deal which is more favourable to the whole of the UK than EU membership cannot be reached, MPs must vote not to leave.

attributes.action: The UK government to endorse the KRG request of independence at UN level.
attributes.background: Kurdistan government has signalled it wish to get Kurdistan region of Iraq to became an independent state. To achieve it, it will need countries such as UK to endorse and support this wish as well as assist in advocating it.
attributes.additional_details: The Kurdistan regional government has demonstrated incredible ability to learn an effective and democratic governance system. Recently it has also demonstrated to have a well discipline and professional army and security services in fighting the ISIS. On the other side ongoing disagreement with Iraqi central government on funding and on sharing of oil production revenue are harming the sustainability of all achievements as well as affecting Kurdistan to achieve its development potential.

attributes.action: Members of BBC Trust should be elected by the public not appointed by government
attributes.background: The BBC Trust is the governing body of the BBC & are supposed to ensure that the BBC lives up to standards of accuracy and fairness. The Trust is responsible for approving BBC Editorial Guidelines. Currently, the Trust is appointed by the government. This should be replaced with public elections.

attributes.action: implement a Law that would ban all hydraulic fracturing (fracking) for 20 years
attributes.background: fracking is still in the early stages of development compared with other mining methods but seems to already be implicated in various environmental problems, a Law that would ban all hydraulic fracturing for a minimum of 20 years will give time to show the long term implications for the environment

attributes.action: Stop Foreign Aid and divert the money to the NHS.
attributes.background: British people pay their taxes towards the NHS. They are having to wait longer and longer on waiting lists due to the service being used by non tax payers who have no right to free treatment. Foreign aid comes out of our taxes so it should be stopped and used for British tax payers.

attributes.action: Reconsider debating ignored petition on Jeremy Hunt signed by 330k
attributes.background: The petitions committee recently chose not to debate a petition signed by almost 330,000 who have no trust in Jeremy Hunt as Health Secretary. This is not acceptable. The public have spoken. He has lied about mortality and ignored the concerns of the medical profession who wholeheartedly disagree.
attributes.additional_details: Jeremy seems to be immune to being held to account by parliament & the public he serves. He has caused a crisis within the NHS -a crisis of trust, of poor morale, and of recruitment & retention. He's gone about his plans for a 7 day NHS in completely the wrong way, alienating a generation of doctors & public. He's lied about mortality rates & imposed a deeply unpopular contract on junior Drs, claiming that David Dalton's letter with CEO 'support' is adequate assurance of the contract's quality

attributes.action: Allow the ownership of handguns in the UK
attributes.background: I am a young shooter and I take great pride in my sport, however I am saddened to see I have had my rights restricted due to the actions of a few and I am fed up of being blamed for the acts of terror committed which does not involve gun owners in any way. Join the Gun Owners United Facebook page.
attributes.additional_details: I believe we should be allowed to own handguns for sporting purposes in the UK. Criminals do not buy guns legally so banning legal gun owners form owning handguns does not reduce crime but instead restricts certain areas of the sport of shooting and this is unfair and NEEDS to end. It is time for all gun owners to unite as one to deal with this problem and get are rights back weather you want a handgun or not. Soon they will push to ban all guns, so we must make the first move to prevent this.

attributes.action: Explain why FCO 30/1048 was withheld from the British public for 30 years
attributes.background: In 1971, an FCO memorandum known as FCO 30/1048 was drafted. This document details how the UK would surrender sovereignty if it were to join the E.E.C/EU. However, this document was classified as Confidential, and not released into the public domain until 2002.
attributes.additional_details:
The surrender of sovereign powers, as a consequence of signing the Treaty of Rome, Maastricht, and Lisbon, is in breach of the British constitution, as detailed in the Bill of Rights 1688.

This Bill has never been repealed, and as such was and is still in force. The contents of FCO 30/1048, and the effect to UK sovereignty, were not made available to the British public during the 1975 referendum.

References:
Bill of Rights 1688
FCO 30/1048
Treaty of Rome
Maastricht Treaty
Lisbon Treaty

attributes.action: Stop HS2 running through the Dearne Valley and destroying our community
attributes.background: On 7th July 2016 HS2 announced their intention to run the line through the Dearne Valley, destroying the new Shimmer estate and blighting hundreds of other homes in the area. In addition, this will involve the destruction of local wildlife habitats and a huge viaduct blighting open countryside.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/hs2-plan-and-profile-maps-conisbrough-to-ryhill

attributes.action: Save Bolsover Community Hospital from closure
attributes.background: Bolsover community hospital is under threat from the public services cuts imposed by the current government. We need your help in saving our hospital which provides fantastic services and relieves the pressure on the larger hospitals which are already under strain.
attributes.additional_details: Bolsover community hospital is under threat of closure from the severe cuts facing all public services. The hospital offers physiotherapy treatment and advice, intermediate care services aiming to prevent people from being admitted to hospital which is essential for all major hospitals in the current financial climate and mental health services for the elderly which are essential in any community. Bolsover has lost a lot over the years, let's not add our hospital to the ever growing list.

attributes.action: Change NHS sight tests to meet the needs of people with learning disabilities
attributes.background: There are huge levels of sight problems amongst people with learning disabilities but they suffer unequal access to eye care. This is leaving many people with poor vision or even tragically losing their sight.
attributes.additional_details: The charity SeeAbility is calling for national pathways of eye care for people with learning disabilities, including for children in special schools, and for all working age adults with learning disabilities to be eligible for NHS funded sight tests. People are likely to need additional time or appointments to complete a sight test. This requires the Department of Health and NHS England to change the statutory and funding framework for NHS sight tests, to deliver an equal right to sight.

attributes.action: Royal Navy ships must return rescued migrants and not bring them into Europe.
attributes.background: Europe is currently suffering from a migration crisis.  This includes migrants attempting to reach Europe in inadequate and overloaded boats.  The Navy has been sent to help with the rescue of those who get into difficulties, but the policy is to bring them into countries already overwhelmed.
attributes.additional_details: People-traffickers are effectively being aided by our Navy, as they merely take the migrants part way in unsuitable craft and leave it to us to complete the journey for them.  This encourages further attempts, putting people's lives at risk, as well as adding to the crisis in such places as Greece and Italy - which then is passed on to us.  While it is humane to rescue, we must send the migrants back, not help them on their way.
attributes.creator_name: Stella Leonora Rosemary Gheury de Bray

attributes.action: TOEIC affected students should be paid compensation by the Home Office.
attributes.background:
Theresa May faces parliamentary investigation over flimsy basis for student deportations
Theresa May is to face a parliamentary investigation after an immigration tribunal ruled that the Home Office used unscientific “hearsay” to deport thousands of students from Britain.
attributes.additional_details:
The Home Office revoked the licences of around 60 educational institutions across the country.
These led to the detention and removal of thousands of international students and migrants the Home Office claimed had obtained English certificates through fraud.
However, the Upper Tribunal heard that the Home Office’s evidence had “multiple frailties and shortcomings” and that Home Office witnesses had no scientific expertise in the voice recognition software at the heart of the fraud.

attributes.action: Save Newholme hospital from closure
attributes.background: Bakewell will lose all its facilities at Newholme hospital under the ‘Better Care Closer to Home’ proposal made by the government. This includes rehabilitation for inpatients along with care for mental health and dementia.
attributes.additional_details:
Other services are also provided for the surrounding community including physiotherapy, podiatry, and other day care services. 
Losing this hospital with the valuable services that it provides would be a massive loss to the local people. Please help to prevent the closure by signing the petition to save Newholme hospital.

attributes.action: Allow britain as a whole to vote for our capital londons mayor
attributes.background: We think as a nation who now is independent should have a say on who is made our capitals mayor the whole of britain should vote in for our capitals mayor
attributes.additional_details: Only london votes for the capitals mayor and we britain should have a say as it is our capital not just a city or town

attributes.action: Grant an amnesty to all illegal immigrants living in the UK prior to 23.06.2016.
attributes.background: Following Britain's decision to leave the EU, many people fear a significant shift to the right and violence against foreign nationals living in Britain. To prevent the victimisation of illegal immigrants by right-wing radicals, they need to have the full protection of the law as British citizens.
attributes.additional_details: Illegal immigrants are already victimised in many ways, for example by being indebted to people traffickers, enslaved as sweatshop workers, and exploited as sex workers. This situation can only worsen if Britain's exit from the EU is understood as a victory for a xenophobes and racists. Granting amnesty to illegal immigrants would provide them with a way out of their current servitude and save them from the aggression of right-wing thugs.

attributes.action: Reduce the 3.9% interest rate on student loans
attributes.background:
I graduated in 2015 with £46,429 of debt. This is subject to an interest rate of 3.9%.

Paying back 9% of my salary over £21k p.a., only if I earn £41k am I actually reducing my total debt.

I ask the Government to reduce the 3.9% interest rate which is out of line with current interest rates.
attributes.additional_details:
A graduate earning £28k p.a. with the same level of debt would (under Plan 2) pay £630 a year but in that year the interest on the loan would total £1810.

By all means the Government can make it easier for graduates by reducing the (Plan 2) 3.9% interest rate but they should not otherwise make the terms of the loan more arduous (as in the 2015 Autumn Statement which froze the £21k salary threshold for 5 years, thereby increasing the annual repayments of many graduates over the next 5 years).

attributes.action: We ask for an independent review of the validity of the EU referendum franchise.
attributes.background: Many UK expats were disenfranchised from the referendum, violating Art.21 of the UN Declaration on Human Rights. We call for an independent inquiry into the validity of the referendum electoral roll and for further government consideration of EU exit to be postponed until its finding is made public.
attributes.additional_details: UK expatriate citizens residing abroad for 15 years or more were excluded from voting in the EU referendum, in contravention of their human rights, as laid out in Article 21 of the United Nations Universal Declaration of Human Rights of December 10, 1948 (General Assembly resolution 217(III) A). We believe this disenfranchisement to be unacceptable, since these UK citizens are among the most directly and adversely affected by the referendum outcome.

attributes.action: Provide information about the EU referendum on 23 June in British Sign Language.
attributes.background: On 23 June, UK voters will decide whether to leave or remain in the EU. Neither the UK Government nor the Leave/Remain campaigns have produced any information in British Sign Language about the referendum and its implications. Deaf voters who use BSL must not be excluded from this historic debate!
attributes.additional_details:
BSL was recognised by the UK Government as a language in its own right in March 2003. In September 2015, the Scottish Parliament enshrined the promotion and protection of BSL in law in the BSL (Scotland) Act.

With two months to go to the election, no materials in BSL have been released by the Government or the Leave/Remain campaigns. We were told by gov.uk that this was because of "extremely low demand", but we have seen no evidence that any consultation with the Deaf community took place.

attributes.action: Parliament should make "essay writing mills" illegal
attributes.background: I believe there are important values that hold human society together: If you work hard, act with integrity, be creative and solve problems then you should get ahead in life. In my opinion, ‘Essay Writing Mills’ are not in accordance with these values. They should be made illegal.
attributes.additional_details: They’re online. They’re in newsagents. They’re being handed around on our campuses. They’re even on the London Underground! Advertisements for ‘Essay Writing Mills’ are appearing everywhere as this industry grows bigger and bigger. More and more students are paying these ‘companies’ to do their work for them. Profiting from selling essays in this way should be illegal. We need to hold our students and our society to a higher standard.

attributes.action: Remove liquid security restrictions at UK airports for operating cabin crew.
attributes.background: Remove restrictions on cabin crew bringing liquids through airport security. The fact that cabin crew have access to a toxic fire extinguisher and an axe but we can't bring a yogurt or water to work seems completely ridiculous and potentially unsafe.

attributes.action: Approved Mental Health Professionals are underpaid and under resourced.
attributes.background: There has been a huge increase in the need for AMHP services and there are scant resources.
attributes.additional_details: Staff are undervalued, underpaid and isolated. Support from agencies is reduced. Service users are suffering. Beds in MH units are scarce and miles away. There is significant risk of harm to AMHPs and service users. There is no recognition of the importance of the AMHP role in maintaining safety within the community and addressing acute mental illness. Resources are being withdrawn. AMHPs need re evaluation in salary and support

attributes.action: Increase award of Queens Silver Jubilee Medal.
attributes.background: The Queen Elizabeth II Silver Jubilee Medal  was created by a Royal Warrant but only 30,000 were distributed in Britain, resulting in only a small number being awarded to members of HM Armed Forces.  Subsequent Jubilee medals were awarded to all serving members of HM Armed Forces.
attributes.additional_details: In recognition of all those who served in HM Armed Forces at the time of Her Majesty's  Silver Jubilee, the existing monies in the Queens Silver Jubilee Trust should now be used to ensure an equitable distribution of the Silver Jubilee Medal.

attributes.action: Recognise and accept the vital need to upgrade the A595. Take action and invest.
attributes.background: Cumbria has again experienced flooding and this has caused road closures - leaving residents stranded. This demonstrates once again the clear and urgent need for the A595 to be upgraded and ensure that it is fit for purpose.
attributes.additional_details:
Anyone travelling from Millom and the south of the borough to West Cumbria face a 100 mile detour when the A595 is closed at Duddon. It is a ridiculous, inconvenient, and unnecessary situation that occurs far too regularly.

The inconvenience to residents and business is bad enough but we must also think of anyone unfortunate enough to have a medical emergency during these closures.

Action must be taken to ensure urgent upgrades that are required to this major arterial A road are completed.

attributes.action: Guarantee the UK will not introduce Welfare Cards
attributes.background: We the people want Damian Green MP (DWP Minister) to Guarantee that the introduction of Welfare Cards will not be introduced to benefit claimants in the UK which breaches their rights under Article 8 of the Human Rights Act.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/1998/42/schedule/1/part/I/chapter/7

http://www.abc.net.au/news/2016-05-04/geraldton-indigenous-elders-reject-cashless-welfare-card-trial/7383366

http://greens.org.au/cashless-card

attributes.action: Stop the resident parent from dictating if the child should see the other parent
attributes.background: Resident parents of children get away far too much with using the child as a weapon and family law needs to be reformed to allow the non resident parent greater rights without going through the court system to see their children
attributes.additional_details: For example; the resident parent not answering phone calls/texts/emails from the non resident parent to make contact arrangements and not been at an arranged place so that contact can be made. Enforcement of court orders should be met with harsher punishments to the resident parent if the order is not kept to. Criminal law needs to be investigated further if allegations are made in family law situations to make it fair for non resident parents.

attributes.action: Mandatory health insurance for non UK citizens
attributes.background: Introduce health insurance for non UK citizens

attributes.action: Make Kratom exempt from the UK Psychoactive Substances Act
attributes.background: Kratom should be included in the exemptions list, so that the Government can at least make an educated decision on this special herb that has benefited so many peoples lives for the better. We believe  Kratom should be reviewed by the government using real case studies and peoples testimonies.
attributes.additional_details: Kratom has helped millions of people worldwide who have found prescription medication ineffective. It has given hope back to people who have relied on opiate based medicines for chronic pain. Kratom has also helped people who have suffered from anxiety and depression and numerous other ailments for years, allowing them to finally get there life back. To make Kratom illegal would have a devastating effect on so many people that rely on this herb and we ask you to reconsider on this matter.

attributes.action: Freeze all disability benefits reviews for Scottish Residents till April 2017
attributes.background: It is only fair that sick or disabled citizens in Scotland should have a moratorium on benefit reviews until April 2017 when the Scottish government take over administration of these benefits.
attributes.additional_details: Scotland is getting control from April 2017 of certain parts of the benefit system including disability benefits.   Therefore, the UK government is wrong to assess people based on a system that will be changing in one year.  The system is not working due to the number of appeals being heard and won by the claimant meaning the administration and decision making is not fit for purpose.

attributes.action: Only Residents and Domiciles should be allowed to own British media companies
attributes.background: In the USA there is a law that restricts the ownership of media to US citizens. Now the UK is leaving the EU we are free to do the same. Only people with a vested interest in this countries best interests should be allowed to control such powerful tools of public opinion.
attributes.additional_details: All the major owners of the pro Brexit press are either non residents in the UK or claim non domicile tax status in order to mitigate their fair share of tax. It is time to put a stop to this in the same way as the EU was trying. Let's finish the job they started.

attributes.action: Give the undermanned Coastal Border Control to our Ex-Military.
attributes.background: We, the people of the UK, want to see our Ex-Military persons off the streets. No soldier should be treated with such disrespect.
attributes.additional_details: Our Coastal Borders are undermanned and underfunded. This should not be the case. Give these wonderful guys/gals the respect they deserve and hire them as Border Controllers.

attributes.action: Give legal protection to the professional title 'Sports Therapist'.
attributes.background: Currently the title 'sports therapist' is not protected in law, and anyone, even if they lack qualifications and training, can call themselves a sports therapist and undertake work on the public. We believe that this situation should be remedied by protecting the title 'sports therapist'.
attributes.additional_details: Currently the sports therapy profession has National Occupational Standards that all training providers should adhere to, there is also voluntary regulation in place, through the CNHC, which was established using government funding. The public are also further protected by an Accredited Register, however, as these are voluntary, it is still up to the individual to choose to be registered. We believe that by protecting the title, this will further protect the public from untrained individuals.

attributes.action: PIP should have life-time awards for life-long and/or progressive conditions.
attributes.background: There should be a category of life-time award for PIP (as with DLA) so that disabled individuals with life-long and/or progressive conditions, which by there very nature will not improve do not have to undergo needless and repeated assessments which may cause unnecessary stress to those individuals.

attributes.action: Have an official public inquiry into Deepcut Army Barracks
attributes.background:
Deepcut Army Barracks in Surrey has been the focus of the recent inquiry into how Private Cheryl James died at the barracks. 
Nobody will ever know the truth unfortunately but the hard fought battle of the James family has opened up some very searching questions into the home of the RLC
attributes.additional_details:
As a former soldier and trainee at Deepcut I wanted to start this online petition to get the government to start opening up about what went on at this place. I was recently involved in the BBC 2 documentary "The Army's shame" During my time there I was subjected to and seen physical brutality on a number of levels. 
The government cannot ignore the goings on in Deepcut any longer!! Please take a minute to sign this petition and let's get the ball rolling to getting it discussed in parliament.

attributes.action: Get full labeling on ALL goods regarding animal ingredients or use in production
attributes.background: I want to have labeling that discloses if manufactured goods contain animal ingredients or have used animal ingredients in the manufacturing process.  A simple declaration that there IS or IS NOT any animal ingredient or derivative used at any stage of manufacture.  Large enough to be easily read.
attributes.additional_details:
I would like it made mandatory that all products ie, tyre, decorating materials, household cleaners, garden products, clothes and footwear, to be clearly marked that they contain animal derivatives such as tallow, gelatine, animal based glues, and shellac.
People may be unaware that by buying a product they assume to be cruelty free is in fact derived from the meat or dairy industry.
Under this new labeling regulation products would immediately be transparent in their mode of manufacture.
